channel.title: Comments on: If This is Wednesday, This Must Be Naxxramas

item.title: By: Calita
item.dc:creator: Calita
item.description: Being a guild leader, I can truly appreciate this. ;) Speaking of Naxx though, I'm currently trying to organize a raid through there, being that I'm not a raid coordinator, would you or anyone else have any information on how to go about organizing a Naxx run? If so, please drop me an email. I was thrust into this position and I could use all the help I can get. *smiles*
item.content:encoded: Being a guild leader, I can truly appreciate this. 😉 Speaking of Naxx though, I’m currently trying to organize a raid through there, being that I’m not a raid coordinator, would you or anyone else have any information on how to go about organizing a Naxx run? If so, please drop me an email. I was thrust into this position and I could use all the help I can get. *smiles*

item.title: By: Miles
item.dc:creator: Miles
item.description: This is a necro comment but I arrived here from a post on my guild's forums. I spent the last two days at work reading through your old posts from the beginning. I'm actually looking forward to work tomorrow so I can continue. Great blog & great stories.
item.content:encoded: This is a necro comment but I arrived here from a post on my guild’s forums. I spent the last two days at work reading through your old posts from the beginning. I’m actually looking forward to work tomorrow so I can continue. Great blog & great stories.

item.title: By: Bisa
item.dc:creator: Bisa
item.description: pre-raid invite tells and other stuff going on all days of the week, how are we able to live with it? ;P
item.content:encoded: pre-raid invite tells and other stuff going on all days of the week, how are we able to live with it? ;P

item.title: By: EndgameRadio » Best WoW PVP Guild EVER
item.dc:creator: EndgameRadio » Best WoW PVP Guild EVER
item.description: [...] I am of course incredibly impressed by this, because I share many of the same base gameplay ideals as the founder of this guild. Here’s what their guild is about. He has numerous references, and people speak highly of him, too, lots of people who spend lots of time PVPing. He’s even quoted to say: I’m willing to spend thousands of dollars on recruiting is so I can avoid nights like this. [...]

item.title: By: A December Carnival of Gamers Feast! at MMOG Nation
item.dc:creator: A December Carnival of Gamers Feast! at MMOG Nation
item.description: [...] I want to make sure to point out Nefbat’s Retroactively ‘New’ Features. He just moved, so he couldn’t be here, but he made sure to send that over wrapped in a thermal pad. Good luck with that green monster, Blackguard! The Wizard of Duke Street has a tasty Comparison of WoW and EVE, and Tobold’s got a great big pile of Guild Management in World of Warcraft under that napkin over there. Brent brought some of the Almighty /Tell he made for VirginWorlds last month. Hmm … smells good too. What did you do, put it in a ziplock baggie? Nice. Then we have Foton, who brought us … ‘If This is Wednesday This Must Be Naxxramas‘? Naxx? Foton, you brought Naxx to a Christmas dinner instead of yams? Jeez. I know you’re a non-traditionalist, but c’mon. [...]
item.content:encoded: […] I want to make sure to point out Nefbat’s Retroactively ‘New’ Features. He just moved, so he couldn’t be here, but he made sure to send that over wrapped in a thermal pad. Good luck with that green monster, Blackguard! The Wizard of Duke Street has a tasty Comparison of WoW and EVE, and Tobold’s got a great big pile of Guild Management in World of Warcraft under that napkin over there. Brent brought some of the Almighty /Tell he made for VirginWorlds last month. Hmm … smells good too. What did you do, put it in a ziplock baggie? Nice. Then we have Foton, who brought us … ‘If This is Wednesday This Must Be Naxxramas‘? Naxx? Foton, you brought Naxx to a Christmas dinner instead of yams? Jeez. I know you’re a non-traditionalist, but c’mon. […]

item.title: By: WorldIV » WorldIV Design Review: Information Sharing
item.dc:creator: WorldIV » WorldIV Design Review: Information Sharing
item.description: [...] I’m reminded of a post by AFK gamer, who recounts the tell-hell of organizing raid night. Tell-hell is a real problem: it annoys community leadership; it consumes time that could be otherwise spent playing (and enjoying); and ignored tells leave community members feeling cut-off. [...]
item.content:encoded: […] I’m reminded of a post by AFK gamer, who recounts the tell-hell of organizing raid night. Tell-hell is a real problem: it annoys community leadership; it consumes time that could be otherwise spent playing (and enjoying); and ignored tells leave community members feeling cut-off. […]

item.title: By: Triarii
item.dc:creator: Triarii
item.content:encoded:
Used to be a officer in what was a For funn level up ur first cahracter guild… and i must say its bin 1 year sins i quit and stil peeps who havent gotten more then 15 levels on thair main character sins then and comes up to me and says WOW where di u get that Nightslayer set WOW i must get me some of that….
Thats when i say “dud ur a warrior 0o”

And he says:” Know but i need epix anyway”

Ur honor i rest my case, the suspect is and wil always be a N00b FTW!

item.title: By: Purplex
item.dc:creator: Purplex
item.description: The casual raiders will be left out in the cold come BC. No more just showing up on farming nights.
item.content:encoded: The casual raiders will be left out in the cold come BC. No more just showing up on farming nights.

item.title: By: heather
item.dc:creator: heather
item.description: Ahh drama. I was reminded today while talking to someone from another online community I used to be a part of that drama is hardly unique to warcraft guilds--any place where people gather online has its drama. It's just far more entertaining in WoW. :D
item.content:encoded: Ahh drama. I was reminded today while talking to someone from another online community I used to be a part of that drama is hardly unique to warcraft guilds–any place where people gather online has its drama. It’s just far more entertaining in WoW. 😀

item.title: By: sarge
item.dc:creator: sarge
item.description:
@Foton Reminds me of a story that occurred on our server a while back. A guy from one of our top guilds sold his account on eBay (Warrior - tier 2/3 mix of gear). However, just after he sold his account he had a problem with his internet connection and thus couldn't inform the guild that he'd sold his account. This issue continued for just over a week.
The guild noticed something wrong when they reached C'thun (duh, a n00b managed to tank his way to C'thun???). Anyway apparently the guy was not known for being a TS talker, he only listened. So the n00b just went silent while the rest of the raid proceeded with the normal 'wtf?' and 'is xxx afk?'. Apparently in and out of raids the new guy had been pretending to be his predecessor.
A week later (they raid 6 days a week), the account seller managed to get on to the guild website to inform them of the news. Obviously they kicked his immediately even though he begged for a trial. A few days pass and everyone has forgotten about another bought account. Until he applied to Uber Guild #2:
Previous Guilds: Uber Guild #1
Raiding Experience: All of BWL, AQ40 cleared up to and including C'thun.
The funny thing is, he hadn't lied in his application!!
item.content:encoded:
@Foton Reminds me of a story that occurred on our server a while back. A guy from one of our top guilds sold his account on eBay (Warrior – tier 2/3 mix of gear). However, just after he sold his account he had a problem with his internet connection and thus couldn’t inform the guild that he’d sold his account. This issue continued for just over a week.

The guild noticed something wrong when they reached C’thun (duh, a n00b managed to tank his way to C’thun???). Anyway apparently the guy was not known for being a TS talker, he only listened. So the n00b just went silent while the rest of the raid proceeded with the normal ‘wtf?’ and ‘is xxx afk?’. Apparently in and out of raids the new guy had been pretending to be his predecessor.

A week later (they raid 6 days a week), the account seller managed to get on to the guild website to inform them of the news. Obviously they kicked his immediately even though he begged for a trial. A few days pass and everyone has forgotten about another bought account. Until he applied to Uber Guild #2:

Previous Guilds: Uber Guild #1

Raiding Experience: All of BWL, AQ40 cleared up to and including C’thun.

The funny thing is, he hadn’t lied in his application!!
